notes:
1. Concept

Present Worth (PW), also known as Present Value (PV), is the current worth of a future sum of money or stream of cash flows given a specified rate of return. It is the standard method for comparing mutually exclusive alternatives with the same useful life.

2. Time Value of Money Factors

The conversion of future cash flows to present worth uses interest factors derived from the compound interest formula.

  • (P/F, i, n) - Single Payment Present Worth Factor: Finds the present value ($P$) of a single future amount ($F$). $$ P = F(1+i)^{-n} $$
  • (P/A, i, n) - Uniform Series Present Worth Factor: Finds the present value ($P$) of a uniform series of equal payments ($A$, annuity). $$ P = A \left[ \frac{(1+i)^n - 1}{i(1+i)^n} \right] $$

3. Net Present Worth (NPW)

For a project with multiple cash inflows and outflows, the Net Present Worth is the sum of the present worths of all cash flows.

$$ NPW = \sum_{t=0}^{n} \frac{CF_t}{(1+i)^t} $$

Decision Rule: Accept a project if $NPW \ge 0$.

solvedExamples.question: What is the present worth of receiving $10,000 five years from now, assuming an interest rate of 8% compounded annually? (P/F, 8%, 5) = 0.6806
solvedExamples.explanation: We need to discount a single future value to the present. $P = F(P/F, i, n) = 10,000(0.6806) = $6,806.

solvedExamples.question: A machine costs $20,000 today and will save $5,000 per year for 5 years. If the interest rate is 10%, what is the Net Present Worth of the investment? (P/A, 10%, 5) = 3.7908
solvedExamples.explanation: The cost is a cash outflow at time 0: -$20,000. The savings are a uniform series of inflows. The present worth of the savings is $5,000(3.7908) = $18,954. The Net Present Worth is $NPW = -20,000 + 18,954 = -$1,046. Since the NPW is negative, the investment is not justified at 10%.
